Ron,
I didn't say it was hard to date Kyo-kinko, just impossible to assign =
to a group.  There aren't different attributions for the different parts of=
 the Edo period.  The NTHK does assign a period within Edo for every fittin=
g or koshirae paper:

=E5=88=9D=E6=9C=9F    Shoki              (the beginni=
ng)

=E5=89=8D=E6=9C=9F    Zenki               (the first part)

=E4=B8=AD=
=E6=9C=9F    Chuki              (the middle)

=E5=BE=8C=E6=9C=9F    Koki   =
             (late)

=E6=9C=AB=E6=9C=9F    Baki                (the end)


=
The NBTHK does not.

I can't even guess at a group on the tombo menuki, and=
 that is the way it is with the Kyo-kinko attribution.  I didn't see them i=
n Tampa, but based on the photos they look like late Edo work.

Agreed with=
 Gordon's earlier comment that there are plenty of early solid gold menuki,=
 including Ko-mino and Ko-Kinko work in addition to Goto.  The recent NBTHK=
 AB display and lecture at Tampa included several pairs of solid gold mainl=
ine Goto menuki from the Muromachi and early Edo periods.

Jim

  ----- Original Message -----=
 
  From: Jim Gilbert 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesda=
y, February 27, 2008 5:36 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Kyo-kinko

  Kyo=
-kinko is non-Goto (non-Mino, etc.) kinko work from after the Momoyama peri=
od. It is often applied to work that is in Goto style but is not Goto main =
or sideline work. Edo-kinko used to be used similarly for work in the style=
 of Edo region machibori kinko schools, but lately this is generally lumped=
 as "Kyo-kinko" as well. So it truly is a grab bag, but the problem (especi=
ally with menuki) is that there is so much Edo period kinko work with no un=
ique character to it that makes it possible to give a more specific attribu=
tion.

  BTW, generic Edo period kinko work of lower quality than Kyo-kinko=
 is attributed to Kyo-kanagushi.

  Jim

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  =

  Hi Ro=
n,

  My understanding is that Kyo-Kinko is the new name for Waki-Goto. Thi=
s would 
  make them a grab bag like Ko-Kinko or even Shoami. Their dates a=
re post-Ko-
  Kinko, so early Edo to Bakumatsu. There is a Kyo-Kinko book o=
ut there. I think the 
  title is Kyo-Kinko no Kenkyu (research into Kyo-Ki=
nko) or something like that. Jim 
  is probably better up on this stuff the=
n I am.

  On on different note, good luck to Harry. Honto ni gambatte kuda=
sai!!

  Gordon
